geeklist.title: Spiel 2015 Preview
geeklist.description:
[floatright][ImageID=1068166][/floatright][b][i]Spiel[/i][/b], held in the town of Essen each October, is one of Germany's two major game conventions, the other being the International Toy Fair in Nürnberg each February. While Spielwarenmesse is a business-only trade show, Spiel is open to the public, drawing roughly 150,000 people over four days. Hundreds of new games will be introduced at Spiel 2015, which takes place October 8-11. This preview covers games that publishers plan to release at Spiel or in the months leading up to it; listings for some smaller publishers show all titles released since Spiel 2014. Some details:
[s][color=#F0F8FF]-----[/color][/s]• This Preview is organized alphabetically by publisher, with games ordered alphabetically under a publisher's heading. Click on a game's name to head to its dedicated page to see more images, read the forums, and so on.
[s][color=#F0F8FF]-----[/color][/s]• In most cases, if a game appears in multiple versions, typically due to it being released in multiple languages, each version will appear under its own publisher.
[s][color=#F0F8FF]-----[/color][/s]• If you subscribe to this Preview, you'll receive update notices whenever an item is added or edited.
[s][color=#F0F8FF]-----[/color][/s]• If you don't care to read about a game and are logged in, click the red X to hide the game listing for both now and future visits. Choose "Personal" for the reason when doing so. You cannot hide a publisher due to this Preview's special set-up.
[s][color=#F0F8FF]-----[/color][/s]• [b]Please refrain from posting "Which booth?", "What's the price?" type of comments since they trigger subscription notices.[/b] Publisher booth numbers, preorder information, game designer and artist signings, and more will be added once that info comes available.
Note that this information has been cobbled together from hundreds of sources, so inaccuracies may have crept in despite my best efforts. I will update game pages as I receive additional information, and BGG users will undoubtedly do the same, thereby keeping this Preview as up-to-date as the BGG database itself.
[b]If you're a designer or publisher with information to share[/b] – or [b]if you have details about an upcoming Spiel 2015 release[/b] – please send me email (wericmartin @ gmail.com). I'll respond as best as I can given the tidal wave of data flowing through the game world in anticipation of the most exciting game convention in the world: [b]Spiel![/b]

item.body:
• Available at the LUDIKBAZAR stand at Spiel 2015, but at the moment neither I nor Viard know where that will be.
• [b]Rules:[/b] English ([url=https://www.boardgamegeek.com/filepage/116391/small-city-english-rules]PDF[/url]), German ([url=https://www.boardgamegeek.com/filepage/120656/small-city-german-rules]PDF[/url]), French ([url=https://www.boardgamegeek.com/filepage/116883/small-city-regles-fr]PDF[/url]), Chinese ([url=https://www.boardgamegeek.com/filepage/120841/chinese-rulebook]PDF[/url])
• Price €60, and you can preorder for pick-up at Spiel 2015 by writing to ageofsteam2012@gmail.com; alternatively, you can hve the game shiped to you should you not be attending Spiel. Viard also notes that he's put aside a few copies for sale through the BGG Marketplace, most likely in November 2015.
[center][ImageID=2499757 medium][/center]

[floatright][ImageID=2587047][/floatright]• A mini-expansion for the game, [thing=179491][b][i]Lembitu: Heavy Cavalry[/i][/b][/thing], is free with purchase of the base game as long as supplies last. Here's a description:
[q][i]Lembitu: Heavy Cavalry[/i], an expansion for the [i]Lembitu[/i] board game, consists of twenty castles that can be used as fortifications, along with six knights; when two blank sides are rolled with the dice of one color, reinforcements arrive for those enemy forces and one knight is placed in front of the chain of enemy units.[/q] • [b]Rules:[/b] English ([url=https://www.boardgamegeek.com/filepage/115371/english-rules]PDF[/url])
• Price €25
[center][ImageID=2437642 medium][/center]

• The English-language edition of [i]504[/i] can be found at the Stronghold Games booth (3-M107).
• MSRP €75; discounted to an as-yet-undisclosed amount for sales at Spiel 2015.

• Since Rio Grande Games won't be at Spiel 2015, 2F-Spiele says that it will have a limited supply — "approx. 200 copies", according to 2F's Henning Kröpke — of the English-language edition of this expansion for sale at the show.
• Far more copies of the German-language expansion will be on hand.
• MSRP €15; discounted to an as-yet-undisclosed amount for sales at Spiel 2015.

item.objectname: The Front Nine: Promo#2 – Fluor-ESSEN-t Golf Balls

item.body: • ABACUSSPIELE notes on its website that only three hundred copies of the German-language edition of this new version of [i]Mexica[/i] are being produced.

item.objectname: Adventure Time: Adventures in the Land of Ooo
item.body:
• Also available in an English-language edition
• MSRP €40, discounted to €35 for sales at Spiel 2015.
[center][ImageID=2531805 medium][/center]
• MSRP €50, discounted to €45 for sales at Spiel 2015.
• Debuting at Spiel 2015.

• Designer David Short has contributed an [blogpost=44888][i]Automobiles[/i] designer diary [/blogpost]to BGG News that details the development of this game. An excerpt:
[q]New idea!!! A racing game where the track has multiple lines of color with various lengths of dashes. Each dash represents your speed basically. The slower speeds will have really really short dashes, so even with many cubes you will only move a short distance. The higher speeds will have really long dashes so each cube will take you a long distance. There will be cards on the side of the board to upgrade your car to various things, like letting you pull out more cubes, or being able to recycle your cubes faster (shuffle). Various cards will have actions like turn one cube into the color of another cube. Or move as many spaces as you have white cubes in your discard pile. Or buy as many cards as you have yellow cubes in your discard pile. Also perhaps each cube is worth one dollar in order to buy new cards (move used cubes to your bag). And then perhaps there is also straight up money cubes and they're worth more obviously. Now, I'm going somewhere.[/q] • [b]Rules:[/b] English ([url=http://www.alderac.com/images/2015/07/Automobiles_rulebook.pdf]PDF[/url])

• [b]Rules:[/b] English ([url=http://www.alderac.com/images/2015/06/Dice-City_rulebook.pdf]PDF[/url])
• MSRP $40
[center][youtube=fTAd9S2Zy0Q][/center]

• Simon Le Minor from Blue Orange says that [i]New York 1901[/i] "will be extensively promoted during the Essen fair with a 100 square meter stand dedicated to the game". In addition, those who visit the stand have a chance of winning sets of gold-leaf pieces for use in the game, with the big prize for the luckiest participant being a paid trip (flight, hotel and city pass) to New York City.
• A German version of [i]New York 1901[/i] will be available in time for Spiel 2015.
• Price €40; you can have a copy held for you by [url=http://blueorangegames.eu/en/games-booking-form/]filling out this form[/url] on the Blue Orange website.

• Can you believe that [i]Hyle[/i] is 36 years old? Crazy, right? Although you probably haven't played it — or perhaps even [i]heard[/i] about it — so perhaps you don't care. In any case, franjos has released a sweet hardwood edition of this game, and I'm the one making this list, so it qualifies as new enough for my purposes.
• MSRP €40, discounted to €38 for sales at Spiel 2015.

[q]The expansion [i]Eight Epics Exceed[/i] increases the difficulty of [i]Eight Epics[/i] for those who can usually clear the base game very easily.
This expansion consists of 16 cards: 12 "situation cards" that make the disaster cards harder to clear and 4 additional disaster cards with extraordinary difficulty.[/q]
• Price €15; [url=http://japonbrand.myshopify.com/collections/all]available for preorder[/url] through the Japon Brand/minimalGames website.

[floatright][ImageID=2618704][/floatright]• Editions of this game are available in English, German, Italian and Spanish.
• Debuting at Spiel 2015.
• Discounted price at Spiel 2015: €38; price for [thing=175314][b][i]Mistfall: Valskyrr – Campaign System[/i][/b][/thing]: €9
[q][i]Valskyrr[/i] expands [i]Mistfall[/i] with a campaign system in different ways. Some of the features can also be used in the classic game variant.
• Legacy Feats: A new deck of special Feats that can be purchased by any Hero. Use these abilities to sharpen your keen edge or supply your Hero with a little bit of what is not usually their forte.
• Setting Cards: As your Hero Develops, so do the Mists. The expansion pack comes with a small deck of cards that will randomize ways in which each subsequent Quest will become harder, as the relentless Mists, aware of your presence, will push back, trying to stop your advance.
• Elite Enemies: The Valskyrr will also come with an alternative version of one type of Enemy from each of the three groups (Wildlanders, Borderlanders and Undead). When introduced by a Setting, these will succeed the Regular Enemies in their respective decks, making the most basic footman of your Enemy a greater challenge to face.
• Epic Villains: Just like the Regular Enemies, some of the biggest and baddest evildoers will receive an upgrade. The expansion will provide you with a final battle that will truly feel like a worthy conclusion to an epic tale.[/q]

• Debuting at Spiel 2015 and available in limited quantity, approx. 350 copies.
• Discounted price at Spiel 2015: €38
[center][ImageID=2630490 medium][/center]

• English rules included in the base game and available via download for the expansions.
• Prices: [i]Blindes Huhn[/i] base game €12; [i]Maus & Habicht[/i] €9; [i]Farb-Mehrheiten[/i] €5; and [i]Vieh-Doktor[/i], free (I think).

[q][i]The Golden Ages: Cults & Culture[/i], an expansion for [i]The Golden Ages[/i], adds the ability to play with a fifth player, while also including new Civilizations, new Wonders, new Future Technology cards, and a new deck of Culture cards.
Players may now progress their civilizations thanks to amazing inventions, or they may spread their own religious beliefs. The challenge to reach for [i]The Golden Ages[/i] is more exciting than ever![/q]
• Also available in a German edition from PD-Verlag.

• Debuting at Spiel 2015 in its second edition.
• Debuting at Spiel 2015.

[floatright][ImageID=2557486 inline] [ImageID=2557481 inline][/floatright]• Debuting at Spiel 2015, along with the two expansions [thing=177148][b][i]The Crew Strikes Back![/i][/b][/thing] and [thing=177154][b][i]5-6 Player Mini-Expansion[/i][/b][/thing].

• Debuting at Spiel 2015 — well, possibly debuting as Boydell [blogpost=44539]noted on August 6[/blogpost] that the game's production partner asked to delay production on the very day that files were headed to the printer. At this point, the game's delivery date is uncertain, but I'm sure that it will be available for demos from a sad-faced Boydell if nothing else.
• Price ~€40, but subject to change from July to October once the production is underway...

[floatright][ImageID=1772379][/floatright]• Price: a few Euro
• Designer/publisher Tony Boydell says that another [thing=119432][b][i]Snowdonia[/i][/b][/thing] expansion will be present at Spiel 2015 — a reprint of bits of the [thing=147695][b][i]Daffodil Line[/i][/b][/thing] plus something new from a game designer pal! — but that item doesn't have a BGG entry as of Jul. 13, 2015, so this is what you get for now.

item.objectname: Snowdonia: Trans-Australian Railway & The Daffodil Line

item.body:
• Available at the ADC Blackfire Entertainment booth.
• MSRP $60

• MSRP €30, discounted to €25 for sales at Spiel 2015.
• Available for previewing at Spiel 2015 ahead of a scheduled release in the first half of 2016.

[floatright][ImageID=2590191][/floatright]• Available in both Rote and Grüne editions from Truant Spiele, with each edition being playable on its own but providing more variety when you combine them in a single game.

[floatright][ImageID=2590207 inline] [ImageID=2590212 inline][/floatright]• At Spiel 2015, Truant Spiele will have two versions of [i]Pairs[/i] on hand: the [b]Pirate Deck[/b] and the [b]Shallow Ones Deck[/b].

item.objectname: Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron
Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man

item.body:
• Debuting at Spiel 2015.
• Price €25
• Available for previewing at Spiel 2015 in prototype form.
• Price €20
• Price €45, with two exclusive promo cards being available with purchase at Spiel 2015.

[floatright][ImageID=2630422 inline] [ImageID=2630425 inline][/floatright]• Versions are available in English, in French, and in English and German.
• Ystari's Cyril Demaegd notes that at Spiel 2015 the publisher will have a few bonus items for [i]Shakespeare[/i] — a [thing=182440][b][i]Prospero[/i][/b][/thing] promo card and an art booklet — but he adds, "We plan to distribute them through BGG, too, for the U.S. customers who can't travel to Germany."
[center][ImageID=2583220 medium][/center]

• Available in separate English, French and German versions.

[floatright][ImageID=930602][/floatright]• Look for this item — the German edition of [i]The Battle at Kemble's Cascade[/i] — at booths 1-F122 and 3-B108 as Z-Man Games is distributed by Asmodee in Germany.
• Debuting at Spiel 2015.
• Debuting at Spiel 2015 and in multiple countries around the world on the same date, October 8, 2015.
[floatright][ImageID=930602][/floatright]• Look for this item — the German edition of [i]Pandemic Legacy[/i] — at booths 1-F122 and 3-B108 as Z-Man Games is distributed by Asmodee in Germany.
